resources.string: Enabling this will send your logs when you send us a bug report or suggest an improvement. Sending the logs helps us debug your problem
The 1.1.1.1 app creates a local DNS resolver to which the phone sends all the DNS requests. This is a log that shows the DNS requests your phone is making.
Logger encountered an error and will not continue
We need this permission to share the log file
Your DNS queries are private and faster
Your DNS queries are not private
You are seconds away from a faster, more private internet.
We\'ll need to install a VPN Profile
1.1.1.1 encrypts your DNS queries, making sure ISPs cannot sell your DNS data.\n\nWe also happen to be about 28% faster than other public DNS resolvers out there.
We need to install VPN profile to encrypt your DNS queries.\n\nWhile the 1.1.1.1 app is enabled, other VPN apps on your device will not work.
DNS over HTTPS is a way to resolve DNS queries in an encrypted fashion via the HTTPS protocol.
DNS over TLS is a way to send DNS queries over an encrypted connection. The 1.1.1.1 resolver supports DNS over TLS on standard port 853 and is compliant with RFC7858.
You chose not to add a VPN profile. Without the VPN profile you cannot enable 1.1.1.1 using our app. What went wrong?
I cannot click OK on VPN installation dialog.

If you cannot click on the OK button, there might be another application on top of the dialog. Some known apps that can cause this are Lux Brightness, Night Mode, Twilight, FileManager. To avoid this problem, close or uninstall all apps that might cause it.
The app will automatically delete each log in 24 hours.
We\'ve detected that your device may be running a Power Manager, which can kill 1.1.1.1 DNS background service.\nPlease make sure you allow 1.1.1.1 app to run uninterrupted in the background.
The status page shows if you are connected to our resolver. It also contains information about what IP addresses of our resolver are reachable from your network.

The Logs help us debug your connection if you are having a problem. The log files contain information about what network you are connected to, what network interfaces the app is using to route packets etc.
If this setting is enabled, the app will attach the Logs to the bug reports.
The Encryption Mode allows you to pick either DNS over HTTPS or DNS over TLS as encryption options.
Your DNS queries are private and faster.
Sorry, your device is not supported.

You have a VPN app that has "Always On" turned on. To enable 1.1.1.1 app, you first need to go to your Network & Internet settings -> Advanced -> Check the gear icon for all the apps listed here on this page. Disable "Always On" for the apps that are not 1.1.1.1

My Internet connection is now faster and safer thanks to Cloudflare\'s 1.1.1.1 mobile app! Get it FREE on the Google Play Store https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.cloudflare.onedotonedotonedotone #1dot1dot1dot1
How long would you like to disable 1.1.1.1?
Until I turn it back on
Must grant location permission to read wifi name for pause
Service enabled but no internet connection found
You can choose the type of VPN tunnel used by the application to route network traffic.
Split tunnel routes only the DNS part of the network traffic from your device. With this setting, you might experience some issues from system components, e.g. Gmail attachments might not load.

Full tunnel routes all traffic from your device. It secures the DNS requests and proxies everything else via local SOCKS proxy. It should be more robust, but can increase battery consumption reported for the app.
